comments:
I started one of the I builds, and received to presentation errors:


eclipse.buildId=I20070319-1005
java.fullversion=J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Linux x86-32 j9vmxi3223-20061001 (JIT enabled)
J9VM - 20060915_08260_lHdSMR
JIT  - 20060908_1811_r8
GC   - 20060906_AA
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  -startup /opt/local/eclipse/I0319-1005/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.0.v20070318.jar
Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86 -startup /opt/local/eclipse/I0319-1005/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.0.v20070318.jar -data /opt/pwebster/workspaces/general330

Error
Mon Mar 19 14:15:55 EDT 2007
Unable to find extension: org.eclipse.ui.presentations.33 in extension point: presentationFactories

Error
Mon Mar 19 14:15:55 EDT 2007
Error creating presentation factory: org.eclipse.ui.presentations.33 -- class is not an AbstractPresentationFactory

This is the result of switching over to make this the 'default' presentation. I'm unsure whether I should check for this or not. I don't want to pollute the code with a check for a presentation whose life-cycle was M3-M6...

My inclination is to take the hit (i.e. add no special checking) as long as the problem isn't there on the -next- shutdown/restart...

Comments?
*** Bug 178116 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I cleanly shut down the workbench and got the same log entries again when starting up a second time.

If it's not too complicated, I think you should add some transition code for M6, but remove it again for M7. It's unlikely that people who did switch before will not use M6, so this would catch most cases and still not pollute 3.3.

When I go to the General > Appearance preference page and just press OK, I get:

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -1
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.dialogs.ViewsPreferencePage.getSelectedPresentationID(ViewsPreferencePage.java:690)
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.dialogs.ViewsPreferencePage.updatePresentationPreferences(ViewsPreferencePage.java:648)
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.dialogs.ViewsPreferencePage.performOk(ViewsPreferencePage.java:991)
at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferenceDialog$11.run(PreferenceDialog.java:893)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:850)
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.JFaceUtil$1.run(JFaceUtil.java:45)
at org.eclipse.jface.util.SafeRunnable.run(SafeRunnable.java:153)
at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferenceDialog.okPressed(PreferenceDialog.java:873)
...

The Current Presentation combo is empty. When I select "Default", I get bug 178155.

I also got the log failure on subsequent restarts.
Also when manually switching to 3.0 pres (intending to switch to 'default' from there), I also got bug 178155, i.e. no workaround.

I tried migrating from 3.3M5a to I20070321-0010.

Transition from M5a (Default presentation) went without problems.

Transition from M5a (3.3 presentation) gave the log entries from comment 0, but otherwise worked without any problems. On restart, no new log entries are produced.

IMO, the current solution is good enough for M6.

We've decided that since this is a completely transient event (i.e. the 3.3 presentation as a 'real thing'(tm) only lived between M3 and M6) it's not worth placing special handing in the code base for...
